newsitem.title: JAPAN: LME prices unchanged in quiet Asia trade.
newsitem.headline: LME prices unchanged in quiet Asia trade.

text.p: London Metal Exchange copper and aluminium prices were barely changed in quiet Asia trade on Friday, as expectations that metal prices might soften further kept players sidelined, traders said.
"The LME has gone through a consolidation. It could rebound again, but there's nothing to trigger a change (in direction)," said one trader. "The metals will remain soft for the immediate future."
Another trader added that, while downward pressure from fund selling ebbed, end-users held back in hopes of lower prices.
At 0650 GMT, LME benchmark three-month copper was quoted at $2,263/68 a tonne, down slightly from $2,270/72 at 1800 GMT on Thursday but up slightly from $2,260 at the Thursday afternoon kerb close.
Aluminium was quoted at $1,548/52 a tonne, down marginally from $1,550/52 at 1800 GMT on Thursday and at the close of Thursday's afternoon kerb.
During the day in Tokyo the dollar advanced above 126 yen from just above 125 yen earlier in the day, which also dampened interest in the market, traders said.
In addition, the Tokyo aluminium futures contract, which was launched at the beginning of last week, saw turnover slide to a low of 1,978 lots, against nearly 20,000 on the day of its debut.
One trader said this destroyed any possibility of arbitrage business.
